name: containerboard production, fluting medium, semichemical | containerboard, fluting medium | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2659/documentation

Semichemical fluting medium is a grade of corrugated base paper, which forms the corrugated middle layer in the production of corrugated board, where is covered between two outer layers of linerboard (e.g. kraftliner or testliner). According to the common sector terminology, semichemical fluting is made from virgin material as opposed to “wellenstoff”, which is used interchangeably with semichemical fluting but is made from recycled material, i.e. uses recovered paper as raw material.;Data for the production of semichemical fluting medium were provided by the industry association CCB (Cepi ContainerBoard). The data for Semichemical Fluting and Kraftliner jointly represent ca. 84% of the total annual production of corrugated base papers from primary fibres in Europe. Primary data were provided by large mills in Austria, Finland, France, Portugal, Poland, and Sweden. Together these mills produced 4 698 905 tonnes of paper products in 2020. Thereby each mill has a production volume of about 94 000 and 467 000 tonnes net saleable paper product (FEFCO, 2021). FEFCO. 2021. European Database for Corrugated Board Life Cycle Studies 2021. Reference(s): https://www.fefco.org/sites/default/files/documents/2022-07-07_FEFCO%20LCA%202021.pdf, last accessed March 2023;In FEFCO 2021 fuel consumption and the related emission to air include only steam and net electricity used on site. Sold electricity is not reported as a sold product and the associated input and output data are not included in the inventory. The fuel consumption and emissions to air associated with the total heat production and the net electricity used on site were allocated to the paper production.;The following air emissions were reported in the study: Particulates, <2.5μm, Particulates, >2.5μm and <10μm, Particulates, >10μm, CO2 (fossil), CO2 (biomass), CO, NOx (as NO2), SOx (as SO2), TRS (H2S as S);For a more complete air emission profile, additional air emissions (beyond the ones listed above) were added for the combustion of the external fuels and internal using LCI datasets for combustion of different fuels as proxy. The air emissions were calculated based on the mix of the internal and external fuels in the study and more information about the fuel mix and the proxy are provided under "Extrapolations". No proxy was available for the combustion of black liquor and "other internal fuels". Emissions from this internal energy generation processes are therefore only reflected in the key emission factors provided by the industry.

The process for the production of semichemical fluting starts with the transportation of wood and wood chips to the mill gate.

The process ends with the production of semichemical fluting medium. Processes include chipping, screening of chips, cooking to pulp for (semichemical cooking process).
category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1702:Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard and of containers of paper a

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for main producers in Europe (Austria, Finland, France, Portugal, Poland, and Sweden)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average of present used technology;The semichemical cooking process is a slightly alkaline cooking process with sodium sulphite and sodium carbonate as active cooking chemicals with a pulp yield of around 80%. The pulp produced is defiberized in refiners, screened and washed before being sent to the paper mill. Semichemical fluting is normally a one ply product and therefore requires a paper machine with one head box and normally also one wire.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Additional air emissions from the combustion of fossil fuels estimated based on industrial heating datasets from the ecoinvent database: biogas and biosludge: heat production, natural gas, at industrial furnace >100kW, Europe without Switzerland; heavy fuel oil: heat production, heavy fuel oil, at industrial furnace 1MW, Europe without Switzerland; light fuel oil: heat production, light fuel oil, at industrial furnace 1MW, Europe without Switzerland; diesel: heat production, light fuel oil, at industrial furnace 1MW, Europe without Switzerland; Coal: heat production, at hard coal industrial furnace 1-10MW, Europe without Switzerland; Peat: heat production, lignite briquette, at stove 5-15kW, Europe without Switzerland; Biofuel (bark, scrap wood, wood, tall oil): heat production, wood chips from industry, at furnace 1000kW, CH. CO2, CO and CH4 emissions from biogas were modelled as non-fossil.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data were collected from the producers by CCB (Cepi ContainerBoard) and FEFCO (European Federation of Corrugated Board Manufacturers) for the European Database for Corrugated Board Life Cycle Studies), checked by technical experts and reviewed by the Institut für Energie- und Umweltforschung Heidelberg (ifeu). The data for Semichemical Fluting and Kraftliner jointly represent ca. 84% of the total annual production of corrugated base papers from primary fibres in Europe. Reference(s): https://www.fefco.org/sites/default/files/documents/2022-07-07_FEFCO%20LCA%202021.pdf, last accessed March 2023

exchanges.description: Estimation based on fuel input data and emission factors from corresponding ecoinvent fuel combustion datasets (see "Extrapolations" comment). The internal fuels mainly consist of the black liquor and bark from the wood input for pulp production. Internal fuels are represented by the calculated emissions but do not have the corresponding fuel input from technosphere, because they are supplied from within the system boundaries. The amounts of internal fuels used in the process are: Black liquor (3.964 GJ/t), Bark (1.707 GJ/t), Biogas and biosludge (0.069 GJ/t), other internal fuels (0.116 GJ/t). No proxy was available for the combustion of black liquor and other internal fuels. Emissions from these internal energy generation processes are therefore only reflected in the key emission factors provided by the industry, other emissions constitute a data gap.

FEFCO (2021). Reported as sawmill residues, hardwood and biofuels: Sawmill residues are reported in tonne bone dry weight (60 kg), biofuels are reported as bark, scrap wood and tall oil in 1.275 GJ/tonne product. A LHV of 18.9 MJ/kg was assumed.

The amounts of internal fuels used in the process are: Black liquor (3.964 GJ/t), Bark (1.707 GJ/t), Biogas and biosludge (0.069 GJ/t), other internal fuels (0.116 GJ/t). No proxy was available for the combustion of black liquor and other internal fuels. Emissions from these internal energy generation processes are therefore only reflected in the key emission factors provided by the industry, other emissions constitute a data gap.

exchanges.description: Estimation based on fuel input data and emission factors from corresponding ecoinvent fuel combustion datasets (see "Extrapolations" comment). The internal fuels mainly consist of the black liquor and bark from the wood input for pulp production. Internal fuels are represented by the calculated emissions but do not have the corresponding fuel input from technosphere, because they are supplied from within the system boundaries. The amounts of internal fuels used in the process are: Black liquor (3.964 GJ/t), Bark (1.707 GJ/t), Biogas and biosludge (0.069 GJ/t), other internal fuels (0.116 GJ/t). No proxy was available for the combustion of black liquor and other internal fuels. Emissions from these internal energy generation processes are therefore only reflected in the key emission factors provided by the industry, other emissions constitute a data gap.
FEFCO (2021). Reported as biocide. Assumed equally split between dithiocarbamate and triazine-compound

The scaling factor of 0.86 accounts for the higher carbon content of peat that was assumed in the FEFCO 2021 report.
